title: All teams present in Team Picker on Team Tab (no favorite team)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that the user is logged in.
GIVEN that the user has no favorite team.
custom_expected:
All teams present in picker.
User can select a team.

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on Teams tab
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will display all teams alphabetically by location 
AND all teams display their team logo

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on one of the teams
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the team is selected and the team selector dismisses

title: All teams present in Team Picker on Team Tab (has favorite team/current team)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that the user is logged in.
GIVEN that the user has a few favorite teams
custom_expected: THEN Selected teams data is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on Teams tab
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the team page is shown, matching the same team shown in Nav Bar
AND a check to the right, indicating it is currently displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on the team picker drop down
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app will display 'My Teams' at the top with the previously favorited teams in the same sequential order, with their team logo to the left

THEN the app will display 'All Team' under the 'My Teams' with the previously favorited teams removed since they are listed under 'My Teams'. 
AND remaining teams are displayed alphabetically by location, with their team logo to the left


in the same sequential order, with their team logo to the right

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on one of the teams (including the already selected team)
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the team is selected and the team selector dismisses

title: My Teams vs All teams displayed within Team Picker
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user has selected a favorite

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on Teams tab
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the team page is shown, matching the same team shown in Nav Bar

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user selects the team name text which proceeds the drop down arrow in the team tab title bar
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the team picker appears with the list of "MY Teams" as well as the additional teams "All Teams"

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user selects the drop down arrow in the team tab title bar
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the team picker appears with the list of "MY Teams" as well as the additional teams "All Teams"

title: Team Schedule
custom_preconds: GIVEN that the user selected a favorite team and is on Team Tab with Schedule selected

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on 'Schedule' tab on team page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the default drop down should show "Home Games"
AND month headers are shown

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user scrolls down the screen
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user should see a scrollable list of games with a ticket button and a promotions link (if applicable)

title: Home/Full Games Filter
custom_preconds: GIVEN that the user is in the Team tab on Schedule sub tab

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the Schedule drop down
custom_steps_separated.expected:
[IOS] THEN the default drop down should show "Home Games"
[ANDROID] THEN the default drop down should show "Full Schedule"


AND a bottom sheet is presented with 'Full Schedule' and check to the right indicating that it is the current selection (*device dependent)
AND a bottom sheet is presented with 'Home Games' without check to the right (*device dependent)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on 'Full Schedule' option
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the bottom sheet prompt is closed 
AND the Full Schedule is displayed and all games returned by the service

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the Schedule drop down (Full Schedule)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN a bottom sheet is presented with 'Full Schedule' and check to the right indicating that it is the current selection
AND a bottom sheet is presented with 'Home Games' without check to the right

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on 'Home Games' option
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the bottom sheet prompt is closed 
AND the Home Games is displayed and only games where the selected team is set as the home team are displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the Schedule drop down (Home Games)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN a bottom sheet is presented with 'Full Schedule' without check to the right 
AND a bottom sheet is presented with 'Home Games' with check to the right indicating that it is the current selection

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on "X" in dialog
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app will dismiss the dialog and leave the last selected option as the displayed schedule

title: Big Icons Open Pages
custom_preconds: GIVEN that the user selected a favorite team and is on the team tab (Park Info)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user selects a big icon
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the selected Big Icon webview should be displayed

title: Team Tab Mobile Ads
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is logged in and on the Team Tab of a team that has ads showing (early 2022 season, Diamondbacks have an Ad for Vizzy)
custom_steps: WHEN the user opens the Team Tab
custom_expected: THEN an ad is displayed relevant to that team

title: Small Carousel Images Open Pages - url is internal or external webview.
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that the user selected a favorite team 
AND the user navigated to the Teams tab
custom_steps: WHEN the user taps on an small image in the carousel
custom_expected: THEN the app will display the page associated to that image

title: Text List
custom_preconds: GIVEN that the user log in to BPapp

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user navigates to Team tab
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app will display the text in team's primary color

title: Venue Image
custom_preconds: GIVEN that the user logs in to BP app

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user navigates to Team tab
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app will display the venue/team image on the top

title: Navigate Between Park Info  and Schedule
custom_preconds: GIVEN that the user selected a favorite team

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user navigates to Team tab
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will be able to have a segment controlled sub tab structure to change between "Park Info" and "Schedule"
AND "Park Info" is set as the default tab

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user navigates between 'Park Info' and 'Schedule'
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the segment control "highlight" will be indicated by team primary color underline

title: [IOS ONLY] Topic Page - Swipe Back Support
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is on the Team Tab
AND clicks on a topic page that contains a back button in the top-left corner
custom_steps: WHEN the user swipes in from the right edge of the screen
custom_expected: THEN the user will be taken back to the team page

title: Promotions List
custom_preconds: GIVEN a promotion link exists within a scheduled event

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user navigates to the Team Tab 
AND user selects a team
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the team page of the selected team is shown

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps on Schedule Tab
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Full Schedule or Home Games with drop down page is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user taps on a promotion link, which is in blue color

Note: Requires promotion link to be present
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN promotion page is displayed

title: Team Data
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app
AND user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
custom_steps: WHEN user select any/all teams for Team Tab
custom_expected: THEN the team data(strings, links, images, buttons, etc) are shown correctly for the particular team

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps on Team Tab
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Team Tab page displays with 30 Team

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN each team is selected
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the team page is shown for the selected team
AND everything(strings, links, images, buttons, etc) shown on the page is correct for the particular team

title: Team Tab Venue Deeplinks
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user has logged in previously to the app and selects a venue Deeplink

NOTE: For this test is is much easier to use Slack with the various URLS.  OR can install 'Test Deep Links and Deep linking' (device)
Additionally, you can use ADB if you have it hooked up to Android studio
./adb -s 92QY1859D shell am start -W -a android.intent.action.VIEW -d ballpark://venue?venueID=2680

-s = The device or emulator to test against.

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user selects ballpark://venue?venueID=32
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Ballpark should open up the Brewers Team Tab

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user selects ballpark://venue?venueID=12
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Ballpark should open up the Tampa Bay Rays Team Tab

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user selects ballpark://venue?venueID=0
custom_steps_separated.expected:
[IOS] THEN Ballpark should open but stay in the state it was in when it was backgrounded. 
[ANDROID] THEN Ballpark should open team picker

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user selects ballpark://venue?venueID=32 AND selects a new team from the drop down header
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Ballpark should open up the Brewers Team Tab AND then should go to the team selected from the drop down.

title: SMS url scheme from team page module
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user has installed Ballpark App
AND user has navigated to team page
AND the team page module has an SMS (in 2021, Nationals has 'Text Alert Signup')


*note: if unable to find an existing team page module, can log into club tools in QA and create a text list module for a team. Create items and specify URLs as described in this test case. (in 2021, Rockies team page in QA has module configured)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN a user navigates to the team tab an selects a link similar to: sms:5555555555
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Ballpark should open up the native messaging application

title: TEL url scheme from team page module
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user has installed Ballpark App
AND user has navigated to team page
AND the team page module has a TEL (in 2021, Nationals has 'Text Alert Signup')

*note: if unable to find an existing team page module, can log into club tools in QA and create a text list module for a team. Create items and specify URLs as described in this test case. (in 2021, Rockies team page in QA has module configured)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN a user navigates to the team tab an selects a link similar to: tel:5555555555
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the native phone dialer should open

title: Native map app url scheme from team page module
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the team page module has an MAP link 


NOTES: If needing to create - Log into club tools in QA and create a text list module for a team. Create items and specify URLs as described in this test case

Teams with Map listed on respective team pages (Mar 2021)
* Rockies
* Indians 
* Astros
* Angels
* Dodgers 
* Rays 
* Rangers

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN a user navigates to the team tab 
AND taps on Map link (OR created link similar to: geo:0,0?q=101+main+street)
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the native map should open

title: UBER url scheme from team page module
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user has installed Ballpark App
AND user has navigated to team page
AND the team page module has an Uber link

*note: if unable to find an existing team page module, can log into club tools in QA and create a text list module for a team. Create items and specify URLs as described in this test case. (in 2021, Rockies team page in QA has module configured)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN a user navigates to the team tab and selects a link similar to: uber://action
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the Ballpark app should prompt to leave and open the Uber application if installed

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN a user navigates to the team tab and selects a link similar to: uber://action
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the Ballpark app should prompt to leave and open up the App Store if not installed

title: MLB App url scheme from team page module
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user has installed Ballpark App
AND user has navigated to team page
AND the team page module has an MLB App link

*note: if unable to find an existing team page module, can log into club tools in QA and create a text list module for a team. Create items and specify URLs as described in this test case. (in 2021, Rockies team page in QA has module configured)

custom_steps_separated.content:
GIVEN user has MLB App (formerly AtBat) installed on device
WHEN a user navigates to the team tab and selects a link similar to: mlbatbat://blah
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the Ballpark app should prompt to leave an open the MLB (AtBat) application.

custom_steps_separated.content:
GIVEN user does NOT have MLB App (formerly AtBat) installed on device
WHEN a user navigates to the team tab and selects a link similar to: mlbatbat://blah
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the Ballpark app should prompt to leave 
AND open up the App store for installation

GIVEN user has installed Ballpark App
AND user has navigated to team page
AND the team page module has an Lyft link

custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the Ballpark app should prompt to leave and open the Lyft application if installed

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN a user navigates to the team tab and selects a link similar to: lyft://action
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the Ballpark app should prompt to leave and open up the App Store if not installed

title: 15 Seconds of Fame url scheme from team page module
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user has installed Ballpark App
AND user has navigated to team page
AND the team page module has 15 Seconds of Fame link

*note: if unable to find an existing team page module, can log into club tools in QA and create a text list module for a team. Create items and specify URLs as described in this test case. (in 2021, Rockies team page in QA has module configured)
custom_expected: NOTE: FSOF uses a weblink for Android. This weblink is not ours and is maintained by FSOF. What happens is the weblink opens, then will direct the user to the deeplink or playstore automatically. This is something we do not control and is maintained by FSOF itself.

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN a user navigates to the team tab and selects a link similar to: fsof://action (Android https://15sof.page.link/mlb-ballpark)
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the Ballpark app should prompt to leave and open the 15 seconds of fame application if installed

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN a user navigates to the team tab and selects a link similar to: fsof://action (Android https://15sof.page.link/mlb-ballpark)
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the Ballpark app should prompt to leave and open up the App Store if not installed

title: Internal Deeplinks from Team Page
custom_preconds:
[BP-10061](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-10061 )
[BPA-6721](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BPA-6721 )


GIVEN internal deeplinks are configured from TeamTab*
AND a user has logged into BP app

*deeplinks configured within  the AZ Staging Only topic page for testing purposes

custom_steps_separated.content:
GIVEN a Team Page module URL that is configured with a Ballpark deeplink (such as ballpark://buytickets?teamID=109)
WHEN  the user taps the module


*deeplinks configured within  the AZ Staging Only topic page for testing purposes
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Ballpark should launch the user directly to the deeplink destination in Ballpark (such as BuyTickets page within Ticket Tab, if buytickets deeplink is accessed)

custom_steps_separated.content:
[REPEAT VALIDATION FOR THE INTERNAL DEEPLINKS CONFIGURED]

Supported deeplinks include:
*My Profile
*MLB Account
*Ticket Accounts
*Favorite Team
*Loyalty Programs 
*Notification Settings
*Team/topic pages 
*Ticket Tab
*Webview 
*Maps 
*Buy tickets

title: TM Deeplinks
custom_preconds:
GIVEN internal deeplinks are configured from TeamTab*
AND a user has logged into BP app

*deeplinks within the TM clubs shows Access Tickets Here
custom_steps: GIVEN TM club on a Team Page on Ballpark app

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user click on Access Tickets Here
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user should be authenticated to TM log in page 
AND validation can be completed without any issue (app crash)
